intro: Eschweileria barbata, commonly known as the barbed eschweileria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, spiky bracts that surround its small, showy flowers. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soil and full sun. Eschweileria barbata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique and vibrant appearance.
